review_text:
We stayed for 5 nights, 4 days - AWESOME The railcar/cabin is EXACTLY as pictured. On the edge of a ranch expanse--- uninterrupted prairie views to admire. Earth and sky---and the occasional mare and foal if you're lucky. Husband was skeptical about the cabin climate (insulated?, etc....) stayed perfectly cool entire time and when cold- faux fireplace not only warmed it perfectly, but added ambiance. Just chilled in front of an LED fireplace and looked out the beautiful picture window with a hot cup of tea.
Perfectly situated between THE canyon and Canyon or even Amarillo. Breakfast each morning in town-- either at Buff's or Ranch House--- hiked the canyon and spent the evening eating dinner in Amarillo. (Husband's favorite was Big Texan so that was the spot) But the locale of the cabin made everything very driver friendly.
Becky our host was super responsive, but otherwise stayed gone. Perfect.
Clean, beautiful, relaxing-can't recommend enough and hope to return ASAP!

review_text:
A must stay if looking for a place in Amarillo or Canyon! The Super Chief Boxcar is full of well-thought out details, top notch finishing touches, and offers great space, both indoors and outdoors.
You will be treated to a unique Sunrise each morning, that will be sure to set the mood for the great day ahead! At evening time, an equally unique Sunset to the West, which you can enjoy from the Adirondack chairs on the porch, or right from the cozy living room!
Your sleep will be blissful as you drift off, Stargazing up through the skylights in the super-comfy bedroom. Or, if you are lucky like we were, bask under the beams of a Full Moon throughout your peaceful slumber.
We pass through Canyon often, and look forward to our next stay in the Super Chief Boxcar! Thank you, Becky, for being a gracious and accommodating host, your property is beautiful!

An amazing place to stay in Amarillo. We booked last minute as a place to stay and gather with local family for a funeral service, and it was perfect. The beds are very comfortable, there were so many towels, and everything we needed was stocked in the kitchen. The pool was perfect entertainment on a cold January day for my niece and nephew, and we had a family video about our grandmother who had passed up on the projector screen when we shared pictures and told stories after the services. It was really an amazing spot.
The house manual is incredibly detailed, which isnâ€™t easy with multiple tv/projector/sound systems, and we were able to work all of the tvs and speakers. Checkout instructions are clear and easy. Checkin was a ring code setup just for me.
One of the king bedrooms is very warm because it is in the spa deck, but Paige was sure to tell us this before we booked and everything was exactly as described. Would book again 10/10z

The beds and amenities were the best that we had encountered at an AirBnB. They thought of literally everything. My only call out for future guests would be to make sure those in your party know the rules and that you keep the doors closed in the spa. When I told my family that spa needed to stay at a certain temp, they just thought not to touch the thermostat but never thought about doors being left open. Even so, the host and manager were kind. I was freaking out that it changed and they were very kind.
Paige, the manager, was so responsive and actually called us before we got there to check in. The owners responded to our questions and even left a little gift for us. Beautiful home & great hosts. Thank you for making our family weekend special.

Truly a healing environment from the second you walk in. We catered in Rosa's, had a cake made by The Ruffled Cup, and hired Amazing Hands By Monica Venske to come to the house and give massages to all of us. I just can't say enough how incredibly necessary it is to disconnect and have downtime. This house made it all possible. The showers are so upscale and huge. The kitchen was big with lots of counter space. The smell when you arrive and the oils and diffusers available to keep that spa environment alive. The gifts and fruit basket. The fridge by the pool. All of it contributed to the convenience and comfort. I loved this experience and so did Mom!!

We cannot say enough good things about this amazing stay!
As tenured airbnbers this was our absolute favorite place!
So impressed with all the details throughout the house that kept it on theme without making it cheesy.

Ches provided so many amenities that it was easy to stay-in and vacation there without just making it a landing spot after driving to other destinations on our getaway.
Ches was the perfect host, was excellent at prompt communication, and you could tell he wanted to make sure all his guest have the best time at his â€œSaloonâ€.

review_text: Connie's place is beautiful!! The pictures do not show how nice this home really is. We only stayed 2 nights but the house was perfect for 3 adults and 3 children. The bunk bed room worked so well for 2 little boys and the bed in the hall worked easily for another child. The beds were super comfortable. Connie thought of everything to host children - toys, books, games. Another special touch was all the light switches were marked which made it super easy to figure out which light turned on what. The house was CLEAN also which is always a big deal to me. Communication was wonderful with Connie. Thank you again for a wonderful stay!

Very soft sheets and towels, too. The proximity to Wildcat Bluff Nature Center was perfect for us to head â€˜homeâ€™ after our hike. The washer/dryer and large laundry room was nice for washing our hiking clothes before we packed up to leave. We had no complaints. We will stay here again!

This was our second stay in Darla's 'Cozy Country Cottage' for my husband and I and our Cockapoo pup. During our cross country travels, we stay in Amarillo for 2 nights twice a year, and this is the place we have decided to book going forward.
Darla is a very gracious host. She responds immediately to all messages and keeps in touch to ensure we have everything we need.
The surrounding area is quiet and peaceful with many grassy areas to walk our pup.
The cottage is exactly as pictured on the Airbnb site. It is spacious, with a fully equiped kitchen, nicely furnished living room, and very comfortable king size bed. Most importantly, it is spotless! Also, it was quite handy to have a full size clothes washer and dryer in the unit to catch up on our laundry. Overall, highly recommend.

Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
The Cozy Cottage was super nice! It felt spacious! We travel with our two teens and dog, and never felt cramped here. The wifi was always working great and the Roku TV was great! The fenced-in dog area was a very thoughtful added feature! I was able to play with my doggo and let him burn off some energy there. The kitchen was well stocked, and our host set out snacks and had coffee and tea k-cups at-the-ready! It was obvious that this host truly cares about their property and the comfort of their guests.
Everything we wanted to do, from dinner at the Big Texan, spraying graffiti at Cadillac Ranch, a visit to the Route 66 Visitor Center, visiting the Amarillo Museum of Art, hiking at Palo Duro Canyon, and playing with our dog at the John Stiff Memorial Dog Park are all less than a 30 minute drive from here! There are lots of great food places like Big Jim's Pizza, and of course all the favorite food chains within a 20-30 minute drive.
Highly recommend! Thank you, Darla!

review_text:
My husband and I (and our Cockapoo pup) drive to Phoenix each year, and we always spend 2 nights in Amarillo. This was our first stay in Darlaâ€™s â€˜Cozy Country Cottageâ€™ and it has easily become our favourite Airbnb in Amarillo thus far. We enjoyed it so much that we have already booked a return stay in May.
Darla is a very gracious host. She responded immediately to all messages and kept in touch to ensure we had everything we needed.
The surrounding area is quiet and peaceful. After a long drive, we enjoyed relaxing with a drink on the front porch. Entering the cottage, we immediately felt at home. This â€˜cottageâ€™ is pleasantly more of a cozy home than a rustic cabin. The vaulted ceilings in the living room and the master bedroom give the place a spacious feel. The recliner sofa in the living room was clean and very comfortable. The king size bed felt like a cushiony cloud with soft white sheets, and we slept very soundly. Most importantly, the place was spotless. Highly recommend.

review_text:
My gal and I had been on a 2 week road trip through the southwest and back again, and wanted to spend the day at Palo Duro. When we arrived, we were so happy to see how wonderful this house was.
It's tucked out of the way from Amarillo, but super easy access to both Palo Duro and the always fun Cadillac Ranch.
The house is immaculate, and has all the amenities you and your family will need. Quiet and peaceful, with an amazingly comfortable king bed, you'll enjoy sitting on the porch swings listening to the ducks and turkeys and roosters across the courtyard while inside the house is perfectly quiet.
Jump on this place if you can. You won't regret it, and the hosts leave little goodies all over the house for you to enjoy.
Will absolutely stay here again on our next trip to the panhandle!

name: Vincent
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
January 2024
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Staying in this beautifully converted 1904 refrigerator boxcar was an exceptional experience, offering a stunning view of Amarillo's plains from the comfort of a modernized, rustic interior. The indulgence of a hot tub under the expansive Texas sky, both day and night, was a true highlight. The shower room stands out, with its original refrigerator wall and floor that retain the boxcar's historical charm.
There are two minor points to note about the shower room: firstly, managing the levers to adjust the shower temperature can be a bit tricky, and secondly, the stylish custom-made shower head delivers a straight downward pour, which might not suit you if you prefer to keep your hair dry. Despite these nuances, the boxcar's charm and uniqueness make it an essential destination for anyone in search of a retreat that's far from the ordinary.

Brian's boxcar was about the same price, but under a giant sky with a ton of privacy including an awesome private hot tub!
Best of both worlds, there was still a nearby town with a giant grocery store a short drive away.

review_text: I had an incredible stay at Bryan's Boxcar Airbnb in Canyon, TX! The clear instructions he provided made check-in a breeze, and his attention to detail in outlining guest expectations was much appreciated. The boxcar itself is a treasure trove of history, and the peaceful, private setting creates a serene atmosphere that's perfect for a getaway. Bryan's hospitality (he responds quickly) truly made this a five-star experience. My husband and I stayed on our way out west, and we truly could not have asked for a more unique experience. It snowed while we were there, and looking out to the pasture from the hot tub with snow falling all around was remarkable! Wonderful experience.

We didnâ€™t use the hot tub so canâ€™t comment on that. A heads up to other tall people, the queen bed will not be comfortable for two tall people. One? Yes. Two? No.

Stayed with a pet
review_text: What a cool space! Private and off the beaten path with the enormous Texas sky above. The space is unique and has such a cool history. It is clean and everything is well-apointed. The linens are clean and the bed is very comfortable. We enjoyed a cooking a steak on the grill and then soaking in the hot tub under the stars. Keep in mind that you are in the country when you book. The panhandle winds are there, but the box car is situated as a bit of a wind break. The good thing about it is that you don't even need a towel when you get out of the hot tub! The flies made their presence known during our stay, but it was not unbearable and the host has made sure that there is a fly zapper and old-fashioned fly swatter for use by the guests. If you want a unique and comfortable stay in the Texas panhandle, book this with confidence.

review_text: Unfortunately we did not end up staying the night. Upon arrival around 1am, we immediately had several strange interactions with the neighbors including hearing voices very closeby on our property which was isolated with no nearby neighbors. When we called the host to ask about something strange we encountered, he gave us a vague answer that left us feeling more unsettled. This along with the swarming bugs all over the front door left us feeling uncomfortable, and since we needed a good night's sleep, we just decided to stay in a hotel. The host never followed up with us afterward, but communication prior to that was good. The place did seem very accurate to how it was described. I believe it would be possible to have a good stay there, but our experience just left us feeling weird.

-The towels provided are very old and need replacing.
-There are only a couple of mugs available and one of them had a handle broken off completely, and knives are blunt
-I had asked for the fold out couch to be made up on booking, this hadnâ€™t been done.

We completed our washing but also had to empty the lint filter on the dryer as this clearly hadnâ€™t been done in a long time and posed a fire hazard.

review_text: The experience was unique and that is what we were looking for. Unfortunately, the area had experienced lots of rain lately and then a heat wave which was the perfect storm for flies. During our stay we were unable to use the hot tub or sit outside do to the number of flies (hundreds) that would swarm and bite you. They would also enter the boxcar every time the slider was opened and the next 40 or so minutes was spent killing flies. The towels provided were extremely thin and worn (should be replaced. Cleanliness could be better, but again you are located on a ranch and in West Texas. We are in the midst of a 60 day road trip (all stays in AirBnbâ€™s) and I felt the cost for what we experienced was overpriced compared to where we have been and where we are going. Canyon is close as well as Palo Duro. This was one of the stays my wife and I were so excited for, unfortunately the fly situation (out of Brianâ€™s control) put a damper on the whole stay.

name: Alida
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
Â·
June 2023
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The boxcar is in a lovely remote location in a wide open field; there are other houses and farm buildings in the distance, but nothing super close. It was very cool to be out on the Texas plains! The bed was comfortable. Amenities are basic, especially for the price (e.g., old/thin/kind of musty towels; minimal toiletries; guitar was missing a string). You have to take your linens & towels to a separate building and start the washer on checkout, despite a cleaning fee.
We had an extremely windy thunderstorm during our stay; water leaked in around the windows, door, and A/C but not into the main area of the boxcar itself.
Accessibility notes: the hot tub cover is *very* heavy (which is needed because of how windy it can get). We were able to use it without a problem, but if you have any mobility issues or constraints, you may not be able to get the cover off. Watch your footing near the bed; there are sunken metal areas next to the bed and it would be easy to trip

review_text:
Great experience at the boxcar! We arrived with a storm in the distance. After a long day on the road, a dip in the hot tub was the perfect end to the day. As we got ready to go inside, the storm clouds made for an amazing sunset.
The boxcar was well furnished and comfortable. The shower was awesome and unique. The layout is minimalist, but perfect for a night on the plains.
The storm rolled through, and the wind moving around the exterior of the boxcar made it sound like you were rolling down the tracks, but there was no movement at all in the car itself.
We only stayed for a night, but would love to come back for a longer visit to explore the canyon lands more fully.
Thanks for a great stop/stay Brian!

Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: Overall, this was a lovely stay. The boxcar looks like the pictures and reading the history of it was neat. The inside was spotless and very cute. The bed was comfortable. The shower was cool, and had plenty of hot water for two quick showers. The hot tub was a fun amenity and perfect to get in after two days of hiking A few flags - the hosts weren't the quickest to communicate on the app, so if you anticipate needing anything, I would make .sure to ask in advance. We asked the night before we left if we could leave our things at the boxcar until 12 (checkout is 11) so we didn't need to leave valuables in the car for our last hike, but didn't hear back before leaving. You are asked to take the sheets to the wash/start the washer and take out the trash. Finally, as the pictures show you, you are surrounded by fields. So, even though the place is very clean, there are traps to catch mice/bugs/etc. under the sink/by the trash. Not a huge issue, but I'm very sensitive to things like that
